summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 regarding FBI agents coordinating access to digital evidence systems (CART/CAIR) for a review of evidence related to the Epstein case. The primary request is to grant access to an agent referred to as 'SOS' to help review 'JE evidence items'.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The recipient of the email chain, responsible for granting access to the CART/CAIR systems for evidence review.

persons.name: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The sender of the initial request, asking for system access for 'SOS' to review evidence related to the case.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: An FBI agent who has been working on the case and is requested to be granted access to the CART system to help review 'JE evidence items'.

connections.person1: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.description: The Special Agent is requesting system access for SOS, indicating they are working together on the case.

connections.person1: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: The Special Agent is making a formal request to the Coordinator for system access for another agent.

connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: SOS is the subject of an access request to the CART/CAIR systems managed by the Coordinator.

events.title: Request for evidence system access
events.description: An email is sent requesting that FBI agent 'SOS' be added to the CART system to review evidence items related to 'JE' (likely Jeffrey Epstein).

NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Follow-up on system access
events.description: Email exchanges regarding an agent not yet having received access to the CAIR system, with assurance it would be available by Monday.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Initial access inquiry
events.description: An agent inquires about not having received access to CAIR, prompting the coordinator to look into it.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain from July 2020 concerning access to digital evidence systems (CART/CAIR) for the Epstein investigation.
A specific request is made to grant agent 'SOS' access to review 'JE evidence items', indicating ongoing evidence review work related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination within the FBI's New York Field Office, specifically the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.
The document is marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' for specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive or restricted content.
